intro: Cerastium decalvans f. glandulosum, commonly known as the glandular mouse-ear cress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically features hairy, glandular leaves that are often covered in fine, sticky secretions. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it easily distinguishable from other members of the genus Cerastium.
